about.title: About me
about.subtitle: A bit about me and my journey in the world of music
paragraphs: I’m Guillem Vila, a musician, producer, and audio engineer born in Arenys de Mar. In my early years in music, I focused on continuous training between Taller de Músics and AULA del Liceu, while also gaining hands-on experience in local studios and projects. I was the lyricist and composer of the first two albums by the rock band Exceso, sharing stages with acts such as La Fuga, Poncho K, Burning, Siniestro Total, and Reincidentes.

In the second phase of my education, I completed a Bachelor in Professional Music at Berklee College of Music (Boston), with concentrations in Music Production & Engineering and Performance, complemented by a minor in Music Technology & Innovation in Valencia. In Boston, I had the opportunity to learn from professors such as Sean McLaughlin, Lyle Brewer, Colin Sapp, Dave Fiuczynski, Scott DeOgburn, and Steve Rochinsky—an experience that gave me tools to combine technical rigor and artistic expression effectively.

After a brief period at Igloo Music in California, I returned to Catalonia, where I combine music production, composition, and audio engineering with teaching. I have taught at Microfusa and, for the past five years, I have worked as a secondary-school music teacher, while continuing to study and refine guitar, bass, vocal, mixing, mastering, production, and sound design techniques.

As an artist, I aim to develop a personal language that blends influences from creators such as Jacob Collier, Billie Eilish, Bob Dylan, John Mayer, and Bon Iver. I’m drawn to a minimalist approach and to music where technique and emotion coexist, with artistic honesty and personal expression as central values. This website is where I bring together these facets—musician, producer, engineer, and teacher—always with music at the core of my work and passion.
